intro: Tristemon simplex, commonly known as the simple tristemon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae, which includes a variety of ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
